“Feel very disconnected - don’t know how to explain it. When we’re talking, we’re not communicating. We’re just saying things. [I’m] boring. ”

“Doesn’t know when to say that I’m being annoying.”

“It’s tiresome to say that [I’m] being annoying.”

I’m sorry that it seems like that. I haven’t meant to be soliciting comfort - but I see how my responses would be dismissive in that context. I’ll stop mentioning it.

I didn’t have anything appropriate or thought out to say last night, and I don’t think I really do now either. It sounds like it’s boring to talk to me, and you don’t want to say that I’m being annoying even when I am. That it’s tiresome to do so is concerning, and again I don’t know what to tell you… “I’m sorry” is equally dismissive because I don’t really think the lack of communication is entirely my fault. I am sorry that you feel disconnected, and I do recognize that I’m not doing enough to try to remedy that, but again, I’m at a loss as to what is expected of me other than somehow be more emotionally present than I am.

You should definitely feel as though you can address this kind of thing with me, I just don’t think I’ll have a solution at the ready.

I really don’t mean to be be pedantic by asking what I do that comes across as aloof. Is that what you mean in encouraging me to say what I like/dislike? Because you really don’t do anything that pisses me off. Call that agreeable or distant, I suppose… I would say something if it was upsetting. I wasn’t going to say anything about you ghosting me since I figured hey, maybe she’s got a lot going on, just isn’t up to it rn, whatever; I’m sure she would/will say something when she cares to. That contributed to my lack of anything to say when you brought this up, since it was kind of a 180º from the way you’d been acting the past few days. For what it’s worth, I’m still not upset about it haha, you’ve been straightforward which is appreciable.

I think one of the things that might have kept me from commenting on anything (still couldn’t name a specific thing you’ve done that’s been irritating) is how independent you present yourself. The “idgaf” what people think (but in a cool way, not a head-ass way) self-confidence made me figure you were pretty comfortable with yourself and that even if I did want you to change something, you wouldn’t lol.

I don’t think identifying what one another does that upsets or satiates the other necessitates an emotional connection.. Couldn’t tell you what does, but that seems like a poor basis (although still worthwhile). I agree we don’t know each other well enough yet –which I think probably contributes moreso than knowing what bothers the other–, and quarantine doesn’t do any favors. Curious to hear what you have to say. Sorry it took me all day, been legitimately busy, not blowing you off.
—

Talk: (Concede) You said you wanted me to think about what I want from being with you  - (2) - I don’t want to lose you though as spending time with you and just talking with you has been one of the only healthy things that I’ve been looking forward to in a long time - you’ve also mentioned that I’m just hard to talk to about some things, and I that I need to press you about that sometimes. - I want to be with you. You are the highlight of my day and I need to tell you that more often.   I want to share my experiences with you, the good and the bad. I want us to learn from each other  and I want to keep being able to vulnerable with you.  - I also want to hear what you want out of this relationship so that we’re on the same page and so that I don’t let you down as I have been

(crit) You also said that you wanted to be the best girlfriend that you could so I don’t think it would be unfair for me to introduce my perspective on the matter. And that you’re not mad, but I don’t know if that’s the case (1) - You obviously feel unfairly shut out and I need to give her credit - I’ve never liked to burden other people with my stress.  I get that you’re more or less receptive of it and would rather that I share my experiences with you, so I could definitely make an effort to be more forthcoming. - As I also mentioned though, it’s not like there’s anything in particular, it’s just been generally bad. Things are better now, though.

(3)
- Like the night before you mentioned that you wanted to take a break, I clearly didn’t pick up the queue and didn’t press you on whatever it was, I’m presuming it was more or less related to this, but I think that the lack of communication understanding goes both ways.  
- You conceded as much, it’s not fair to expect me to press you on everything, and I don’t think it’s fair for you to be as upset as you are towards me for not sharing everything with you either.

Q said:

  • feel like most of the time when I’m not there, it feels like I don’t even like her
  • sometimes I’m nice and cute, most of the time it’s just kinda like feels like we’re just friends kinda Startover
  • I feel like I only treat her like I’m her gf sometimes and it hurts her feelings

  • I wrote in the letter why I’m upset. Whenever she tries to help or give advice you don’t respond.

    • some response is better than nothing/being short about it.
  • I feel like I’m trying more than you are. But she gets what I would
  • words don’t mean anything to me (if actions say otherwise). I’m really understanding. Feels like she has a good grasp about how people would react. Not that she’s like a social savant, but I should give her some credit about helping me out
  • she knows what she needs and wants from other people.
  • I’m two different people (when I’m drinking / not) which is very irritating. It needs to stop.
  • for example - her dad, he left, not complaining. Whole life he just wasn’t present, but everyonce in a while he’ll pop in disingenuously with “miss you love you”. If he doesn’t take the time out to actually give a shit, then it doesn’t mean. And when it does happen, she has to put in the work. He’s a grown man, he travels for work it’s not like he doesn’t have the time to come visit his children.

I said my shit, she respons

  • She has been actively trying to work on it,
  • she doesn’t like giving more and getting less, out of pride, bad, obv, but that’s the way she feels
  • I think about you a lot, like a lot a lot, and it’s very distracting

  • People need to be ready to deal with things that are uncomfortable. People need to deal with the fact that you’re upsetting.

    • need to confront it
    • Fav bible verse, I say it, but then I’m a pussy bitch alcoholic
    • “By Faith he made himself known in the land of the stranger”
  • Thought she was emotionally more mature and didn’t need someone to “catch up” to her level

Oct 5 th Can we talk whenever you come pick up your stuff. I don’t want to keep you in this relationship if you do think that it’s unhealthy for you, and I don’t want you to stay on my behalf, but I know that I’d be worse off for it.

I’m bad at expressing or reciporocating my affection, but I don’t think you’re always receptive of it either, or you discount the time that we do spend together as not counting for much.

The past 2 weeks have been really rough, and we’ve both been too busy, and I can tell that you feel neglected. I hate that it seems that way, because I don’t take you for granted.

I know that you’ve said that there are just some things that we can’t change, but you’ve also pointed out several that I can. I want to make you feel the way that you make me feel.

I’m not doing a good enough job at adjusting, and you’ve let me know twice at this point. I don’t know if that makes a difference. Or even if it does, whether that outweighs how you feel, but I really don’t want it to seem like I’m indifferent or giving up or not trying. I just don’t want you to feel miserable with me.

Numinar - First off I just wanted to say thanks so much for reaching out and being able to meet with me on such short notice. I know you said we could chat sometime next week but time is really of the essence for me at the moment haha. 

- I’m a senior studying computer science and minoring in PPE which is the intersection of Philosophy, Politics, and Economics. Assuming that the finals coming up in about a week don’t go too terribly, I’ll just have one semester left in the fall before I graduate. 

- What I’ve worked on in the past
- Like I mentioned in my LinkedIn post, my internship got cancelled, but prior to that I’d been working part time for that company for almost two years. This would have been my third summer. I worked on a variety of tasks, but most notable would be the team I was on last summer through to January which was the AI branch I suppose. We were researching and implementing a variety of RL techniques including Soft Actor Critic, Auto encoders, and DDPG for service scaling policies and anomaly detection. 

- I was working on a heat map feature over the summer and winter breaks 

- along with deploying the service into the competitor’s Istio’s service mesh networks which was a pretty fun exercise this past winter

- MENTION RECOMMENDATION LETTER 

- DCLRS: sat in on a bunch of virtual senate and congressional committee hearings mainly focused on COVID, environmental issues, 

- During that podcast you mentioned how difficult it has been find people who meet the levels of passion in the intersection of technology, politics, and conservative values which I have to say made me really excited since I have to say that’s a pretty good description of myself

Technical

  • Luke, son CTO of Numinar
  • Other son is Mech Eng / Comp Eng
  • Small group, in Norman, Oklahoma (Tom Cole’s District)
  • No babysitting
  • Huge data, current platform can’t handle it
  • Looking to be able to handle the huge voter files

  • consultant who handles the SQL backend things which has set them up to try to handle the front-end code

    • react web platform
    • heavy into Redux
  • He does a lot of the back-end-front-end stuff (interfacing w/Postrgres/SQL and throwing it into a redux store so the FE people can create nice screens)
  • Mobile app react-native. In the middle of releasing V2 by the end of the month/mid June following the same platform as the mobile platform
  • Using Google Cloud, shifting to AWS. Most of it runs on Docker, the consultant has taken that over – I wouldn’t have to touch that

  • could use help interfacing w/that, mostly need React w/ Materialize

    • I can learn quickly
  • they don’t have time to get someone up to speed
  • setting up the dev environment is a time consuming hassle
  • looking for interns who can just pick up tasks and run with them

My questions

  • he’s been there a year
  • His son is the CTO, but he doesn’t have time to do stuff other than directional stuff
  • He works full time for Genesis
  • He hadn’t finished school, started working at a hedge fund for crypto (at 22), he has to stick around for like 3 years to realize the payout but he’s been well-compensated. He’s splitting his time
  • He returned to NY for COVID, his dad jumped over to Numinar
  • Argin is the other founder, PhD in Poli-sci from Harvard
  • Interns, typically have 2-6 interns at a time. Currently 2 dev interns, one of them getting a full time offer, the other leaving for AWS
  • Roger, Dom, other guy in may, then Michael the consultant are the full time devs
  • Lot of people in the WeWork office

Logistics: - when would it start - Need to get the shot, not an antivaxxer or anything like that - compensation? - Duration: flexible, on a personal level

  • personal project I’ve been working on:

    • maintaining podcast website for about a year now, started off as a side project over the summer to add a front-end project to my portfolio
    • At first it was just a simple landing page with some info about the show, links to recent episodes, etc.
    • One of the hosts asked that I add a section to hold the episode transcripts which was no big deal at first since there were only about 20 episodes,
    • several months later though, the single page monolithic design had pretty abysmal performance since the browser would have to load like 10,000 lines of episode transcripts
    • so, this past weekend, after I took my last final I worked on writing a script to automatically paginate new pages for each episode, containing the info about episode, streaming links, and the transcript which increased the loading time score by a factor of 9 on mobile, and doubled the score for the desktop version of the app
    • just had all the relevant info for each episode in a csv then I made a template file for the individual episode page, then the python script just reads the csv and template file and creates a new html file for each entry in the css info file

Thanks so much for your time

  • AECOM-CallTracker:

    • Project my brother recruited me for when he was working at a call center in Ponce, P.R.
    • Jack told me that (Tim) had the chance to take a look at it but just to give a general description, the call center was manually tracking their calls which sounded like a great use case for web scraping and automation
    • I started out just trying to use BS4, but had a heck of a time working the HTML parse tree of the website where the data was coming from, so I pivoted to using Selenium with a full blown web driver so I could manage the website loading times in Ponce, interactivity needed to extract the data, etc.
    • I then just displayed through that data onto a simple flask app to measure some simple analytics
    • Sorry about including the server url in the instruction readme, he said I needed to be pretty explicit and I didn’t think of the implications. I just set the repo to private until I have time to go prune the revision history to remove trace of any other sensitive info

Credit Karma

  • Introduction
  • First off I just wanted to say thanks so much for reaching out and being able to meet with me on such short notice
  • I’m a senior studying computer science and minoring in Philosophy, Politics, and Economics. Assuming that the last two or three finals I have to taken don’t go too terribly, I’ll just have one semester left in the fall before I graduate.

  • Seems like it’s a financial multi platform. The obvious service I’m aware of is the free credit score calculations but even just looking at the website, I know that there’s a litany of other financial services offered through the platform

    • I spoke with Colleen around New Years and she mentioned a bunch of hullabaloo about the Acquisition from intuit which is does TurboTax, the (personal finance) Mint app, and some other accounting software IIRC
    • So, to me it sounds like CK is or could be in the near future, ubiquitous to finance use cases
  • broadening my tech stack and developing my existing skills is my top priority

MY QUESTIONS: - 12 weeks when does it start June 1st or June 15th - Sept 3rd - How big their internship program is: 36 - community / comraderie oriented - What kind of TechStack they use - What I should expect in terms of follow up: can do both in the same day, will schedule it for next week THEIR INFO: - 12 week program, treated as a full time employee. Invited to all the CK employee meetings - Lunch n learns, demo days, virtual events, etc. - totally remote - CS undergrad interns make $36/hour - 2 rounds for the interview process, 45 mins each, 1:1. A coding round via phone, then a 1:1 w/ a hiring manager for a behavioral - Advice: set it up verbally, verbalize your thought process, planning is key + they give you hints, good communication skills, coach ability – they want to see that you can respond to the hint and be mentor-able. - Check out CK app and all the services offered, be able to align my passions with CK’s mission, be able to talk about the Credit Karma

Cover Letter:

I’m applying for the Summer 2021 Software Intern program at Credit Karma. Ms. McCreary recommended that I apply despite the short lead time and I’m very thankful for the competitive opportunity. I’m passionate about technology, I enjoy learning, and I hope that I can apply the skills that I’ve learned through my university coursework and prior internships to Credit Karma’s products and services.

My technical skillsets primarily lie in back-end development and data modeling/analytics. I enjoy programming in Python (who doesn’t!) but have educational and recreational experience in a variety of other programming languages including C, Java, HTML & CSS, JavaScript/React. My non-technical stack includes planning, organization, and communication. I have professional experience working in teams and the agile development framework, and through my experience Coaching, organizing, and attending hackathons, I’ve developed solid leadership and follower-ship behaviors.

I’m a motivated student who can learn independently and thrive with mentorship. During the initial screening call for this position, Ms. Michaela Green mentioned that the hiring process involves matching the interns with managers to ensure favorable teams which further excited me about this position. I think that the most valuable use of my time this summer involves broadening my existing skills and developing new ones, and this position represents a fantastic opportunity to do just that. The prospect of a curated team of similarly impassioned interns and focused mentorship is invaluable at this stage of my career.

Thank you for the consideration! Peter Murphy

Karma Code HELPFULNESS - we go above and beyond to help others succeed

EMPATHY - seek first to understand, then be understood

PROGRESS - hustle, learn and improve

OWNERSHIP - step up and own our decisions, actions and results - I think this is a great core value. It strikes me as empowering for employees. Like if ownership and responsibility are encouraged throughout the hierarchies of management it seems as though a level of trust comes along with that where your colleagues and superiors should have your back. - I think it ties in really well with the empathy aspect as well as the accountability of ownership is predicated on the understanding that folks aren’t going to immediately assume the worst

Credit Karma Behavioral Why I’m interested in Credit Karma: So, I organize and help out at a ton of hackathons for my other job, and I’m not gonna lie, for awhile I’d been kind of turned off the fin tech space just because of the over saturation of projects like that I see at hackathons. A lot of projects lack novelty or even the claimed functionality, and it’s kinda mentally exhausting to see folks present their health-related projects as a cure to cancer and similarly for the financial hacks a solution to poverty developed in like 36 hours.

It seems like a lot of projects like that lack the background research into the domain necessary to develop an actually meaningful solution and I know that right now I don’t have that knowledge so I’ve never really taken a crack at a project like that, but I think that working with industry professionals in this financial space would definitely be super valuable in that sense. Even though this would be a software engineering position, I think I’d gain a ton of knowledge about everything that goes on from logistical level in terms of delivering the services to the customers

Using the app Not sure if it’s just because I’m a new user on the app, but after using some of the features like the tax return estimate, the app would automatically launch another feature that was a continuation of the previous feature. I think this is a really good feature if it is the case that it only happens for new users in order to familiarize themself with the breadth of the services available through the app and they were easy to exit or cancel if I didn’t want to go through with the form or whatever, but it would definitely get tedious if the app kept trying to get me to fill out more forms after I’d finished the one use case I needed at that time

I was poking around some of the other features as well such as the car loan calculator and despite not currently being interested in buying a car right now, I could see how this would actually be a tool I would use if I needed to take a loan to purchase a vehicle rather than having two independent setups like browsing the web and making these calculations on the app separately which is hard to pull off. Typically, user interface wrappers like that just don’t hold up against the “intended” browser based experience, but the app remained clean, fast, responsive, and as content rich as I think I would desire if I were actually in the market. For that feature in particular as well, I really like the explanation for why Carvana. When I saw the “Our recommendation heading” I cynically thought, “what’s in it for Credit Karma, there must be some kind of partnership here,” but then I scrolled down and my question was immediately answered by the subsequent “Why Carvana” section. I thought that was pretty neat and kept scrolling down to see the feedback foot section of the page which made it easy for me to just click “yes or no” in response to whether that page was helpful without intruding or interrupting my use of the app or redirecting me to another page to fill out a survey or something.

The only such intrusions that I experienced were security related and pretty necessary to proceed with those feature dialogues like “view compromised passwords”.

The last thing I would mention that I enjoyed about using the app was the friendly UI. A lot of the time when companies or developers try to swap out functional terms like “okay, select plan, view accounts” with more conversational phrases like “Let’s do this!” It comes across as corny and reminiscent of the Windows 10 crash message meme that’s like “Uh oh, something went wrong but don’t worry our code monkeys are working very hard to fix this”. However,I thought that the departure from bog standard language to positive language was tasteful and not too in your face.

Bachelor Party Hey folks! This is Peter Murphy, I just wanted to start a group chat to begin coordinating Jack’s Bachelor Party. Despite how funny I think it would be, Maggie has instructed me to disallow strippers (even of the male variety) from whatever it is we end up doing. Additionally, in order to make sure we can accommodate Charlie as well, I imagine it’s probably best we choose something that’s not exclusive to 21+.

I think the best middle ground is probably a sporting event sometime in the next few months and then perhaps a nice dinner afterwards? But I’m totally open to suggestions though, and I think the main constraint is when the most people are available.
